answers.text:
Hello:
I found some resources on the Knowledge Network that may help you with your project. These are about resource sharing at the local level in general. I hope they help.
This is a report from the National League of Cities and the Alliance for Regional Stewardship provides advice, guidelines and case studies for shared service options at the local, state and regional level. For every option provided, there is a concrete, real-world example of a municipality or county successfully implementing a similar program or initiative, as well as relevant contact information: http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/301761/Guide_to_Successful_Local_Government_Collaboration_in_Americas_Regions
This 21 page case study from 2007 is from the New York Department of State, and it looks into a wide variety of very successful shared services partnerships : http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/301695/Shared_Municipal_Services_Technical_Assistance_Project
This is a manual from the New York state Comptroller, there is a step-by-step process given for implementing shared services within a local government.  From the initial consideration of legal authority in the process, all the way to implementing project reporting for the process of the new shared service, this guide has a lot of very useful information: 
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/301683/Local_Government_Management_Guide_Shared_Services_in_Local_Government
This is a case study about shared studes by the Department of Technology Services: http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/301712/Shared_Services
Peggy Chasler
Knowledge Network Intern
pchasler@icma.org

author: Eric Johnson
text: Tampa and Hillsborough County (Florida) will be jointly purchasing and implementing ERP software, and using remote hosting. To equitably allocate monthly hosting services that were bid by a major vendor in this field with a single, combined cost, these local governments are seeking information on metrics that can be used to split the invoices. The implementor, after contacting the hosting provider, has indicated the hosting company "does not have any user based metric reporting that would provide this data."  What reports or tools should be available to allocate hosting costs?
title: Hosting services metrics to allocate costs
